title: Banking Ecosystem: What Do Retail Clients Expect (Au et al., 2022)
content:
This paper examines how traditional banks can create new revenue streams by going "beyond banking" - offering products and services outside their traditional portfolio.

KEY CONCEPTS:
- "Beyond Banking": Banks seeking new revenues beyond classic financial products/services
- "Banking Ecosystem": Integration of third-party providers into a bank's offering
- "Open Banking": Using API technology to integrate FinTech solutions

CUSTOMER NEEDS IDENTIFIED (German retail clients):
1. Digital vouchers (55% interested)
2. Deposit marketplace platforms (51%)
3. Digital identity management services (49%)
4. Digital tax services (48%)
5. Social trading/investment guidance (48%)

KEY FINDING: Financial products/services are more relevant to customers than non-financial offers, but non-financial services (like digital identity) still rank highly.

STRATEGIC IMPLICATIONS:
- Banks can integrate FinTechs rather than building solutions organically
- Commission-based revenue models (like Uber/Airbnb) are applicable
- Banks' reputation for security can be leveraged for new services
- German banks show ~1% RoE vs much higher for US/Asian banks, driving need for new revenue
source: Au, C-D., Krahnhof, P., Klingenberger, L. (2022). Banking Ecosystem: What Do Retail Clients Expect from the Modern Financial Services Industry? Universal Journal of Accounting and Finance 10(2): 498-508
